001/*

004 */
005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.constraint;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.constraint.impl.DefaultAllowedValuesConstraint;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
010
011import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
012import java.util.Map;
013
014import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
015import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.Nullable;
016
017/**
018 * Represents a rule requiring the value of a field or flag to match the name of
019 * one entry in a set of enumerated values.
020 */
021public interface IAllowedValuesConstraint extends IConstraint {
022  boolean ALLOW_OTHER_DEFAULT = false;
023  @NonNull
024  Extensible EXTENSIBLE_DEFAULT = Extensible.EXTERNAL;
025
026  /**
027   * Indicates how an allowed values constraint can be extended, or if it can be.
028   */
029  enum Extensible {
030    /**
031     * Can be extended by external constraints. The most permissive level.
032     */
033    EXTERNAL,
034    /**
035     * Can be extended by constraints in the same model.
036     */
037    MODEL,
038    /**
039     * Cannot be extended. The most restrictive level.
040     */
041    NONE;
042  }
043
044  /**
045   * Get the collection allowed values associated with this constraint.
046   *
047   * @return a mapping of value to the associated {@link IAllowedValue} item
048   */
049  @NonNull
050  Map<String, ? extends IAllowedValue> getAllowedValues();
051
052  /**
053   * Get a specific allowed value by name, if it is defined for this constraint.
054   *
055   * @param name
056   *          the value name
057   * @return the allowed value or {@code null} if the value is not defined
058   */
059  @Nullable
060  default IAllowedValue getAllowedValue(String name) {
061    return getAllowedValues().get(name);
062  }
063
064  /**
065   * Determines if this allowed value constraint is open-ended ({@code true}) or
066   * closed. If "open-ended", the constraint allows the target's value to by any
067   * additional unspecified value. If "closed", the constraint requries the
068   * target's value to be one of the specified values.
069   *
070   * @return {@code true} if the constraint is "open-ended", or {@code false}
071   *         otherwise
072   */
073  boolean isAllowedOther();
074
075  /**
076   * Determines the degree to which this constraint can be extended by other
077   * constraints applied to the same value.
078   *
079   * @return the enumeration value
080   */
081  @NonNull
082  Extensible getExtensible();
083
084  @Override
085  default <T, R> R accept(IConstraintVisitor<T, R> visitor, T state) {
086    return visitor.visitAllowedValues(this, state);
087  }
088
089  /**
090   * Create a new constraint builder.
091   *
092   * @return the builder
093   */
094  @NonNull
095  static Builder builder() {
096    return new Builder();
097  }
098
099  final class Builder
100      extends AbstractConstraintBuilder<Builder, IAllowedValuesConstraint> {
101    @NonNull
102    private final Map<String, IAllowedValue> allowedValues = new LinkedHashMap<>(); // NOPMD not thread safe
103    private boolean allowedOther = ALLOW_OTHER_DEFAULT;
104    @NonNull
105    private Extensible extensible = EXTENSIBLE_DEFAULT;
106
107    private Builder() {
108      // disable construction
109    }
110
111    /**
112     * Use the provided allowed value to validate associated values.
113     *
114     * @param allowedValue
115     *          an expected allowed value
116     * @return this builder
117     */
118    @NonNull
119    public Builder allowedValue(@NonNull IAllowedValue allowedValue) {
120      this.allowedValues.put(allowedValue.getValue(), allowedValue);
121      return this;
122    }
123
124    /**
125     * Use the provided allowed values to validate associated values.
126     *
127     * @param allowedValues
128     *          an expected allowed values
129     * @return this builder
130     */
131    @NonNull
132    public Builder allowedValues(@NonNull Map<String, IAllowedValue> allowedValues) {
133      this.allowedValues.putAll(allowedValues);
134      return this;
135    }
136
137    /**
138     * Determine if unspecified values are allowed and will result in the constraint
139     * always passing.
140     *
141     * @param bool
142     *          {@code true} if other values are allowed or {@code false} otherwise
143     * @return this builder
144     */
145    @NonNull
146    public Builder allowsOther(boolean bool) {
147      this.allowedOther = bool;
148      return this;
149    }
150
151    /**
152     * Determine the allowed scope of extension for other constraints matching this
153     * constraint's target.
154     *
155     * @param extensible
156     *          the degree of allowed extension
157     * @return this builder
158     */
159    @NonNull
160    public Builder extensible(@NonNull Extensible extensible) {
161      this.extensible = extensible;
162      return this;
163    }
164
165    @Override
166    protected Builder getThis() {
167      return this;
168    }
169
170    @NonNull
171    private Map<String, IAllowedValue> getAllowedValues() {
172      return allowedValues;
173    }
174
175    private boolean isAllowedOther() {
176      return allowedOther;
177    }
178
179    @NonNull
180    private Extensible getExtensible() {
181      return extensible;
182    }
183
184    @Override
185    protected IAllowedValuesConstraint newInstance() {
186      return new DefaultAllowedValuesConstraint(
187          getId(),
188          getFormalName(),
189          getDescription(),
190          ObjectUtils.notNull(getSource()),
191          getLevel(),
192          getTarget(),
193          getProperties(),
194          getAllowedValues(),
195          isAllowedOther(),
196          getExtensible(),
197          getRemarks());
198    }
199  }
200}
